replies.bodyText:
An interface with a named method for sending progress which doesn't couple us directly to either CollectionTask or TaskData (this is useful as we can send multiple categories of progress notifications for this operation and the ideal would be to be able to differentiate them).
It's ideal to avoid circular dependencies when feasible.
Especially so in the case of CollectionTask, where know it requires both a hard reference to the Android framework, and when the underlying mechanism (AsyncTask) has been deprecated in the latest version of Android.

replies.bodyText:
Are you referring to the lines setCanceledOnTouchOutside ?
Because if so, I believe you're wrong.
setCanceledOnTouchOutside ask whether touching anything that is not the dialog trigger cancelling.
cancelable(bool) ask whether the dialog is cancelable.
So cancelable(true) followed by setCanceledOnTouchOutside(false) means that you can cancel, but that it is cancelling only by pressing a "back" button and not by pressing any part of your screen by accident
